intro: Strombosia latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved strombosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators. Strombosia latifolia is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
